dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: SMALL TV FRAME OVER BLACK SCREEN: at an air force base somewhere, a newS REPORTER in short sleeves and ear phone holding a microphone, stands under the burning sun. He is breathless, excited, on the verge of hyperventilati this is the biggest story of his young life!

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER
dialogues.text: Good morning. On this day, July lst, 2014, at this hour - 0600 - 78 countries have begun... ROOOAAAAR - a Military Jet takes off in b.g. Reporter hol a hand to one ear over his ear phone and shouts to be hea REPORTER (CONT’D) 78 countries have begun to disperse CW-7. CW-7 has been the subject of much controversy as environmental groups have protested its development and deployment. ROOOAAAAR - another jet takes off as Reporter takes up a soccer ball size plastic MODEL in his hand. REPORTER (CONT’D) CW-7. This is a core molecular model of CW-7. CW-7 is the answer to global warming...it has been claimed. ROOOOOAAAR - this one goes right over Reporter's head - h ducks as if the jet will hit him; scared and exhilarated. REPORTER (CONT’D) Today, as we speak and as you can see - here and around the world... CUT TO: IMAGE of military aircraft, against the sky, dispersing CW-7, leaving streaks of white behind them.

dialogues.speaker: REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: CW-7 is being deployed into the upper layers of the atmosphere where it will bring down average global temperatures to the optimum levels of the last century. And we are witnessing it! REPORTER grows ever more flush with giddy excitement over roughly shaking image with an explosive noise of a succes of jets taking off...  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 2. REPORTER (CONT’D) We are witnessing the very, the very, the very avalanche of a new dawn. Today will forever be known as the beginning of the end - the end of our long crisis; the end of our suffering and our fear; the end of the, the, the tyranny of global warming! Good bye global warming. ROOOOOAAAAR - the image has become so shaky, we can barel see the REPORTER as he drops the CW-7 model and shouts: REPORTER (CONT’D) This is the end!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH TELEPHOTO LENS: a foggy, dreamy image of white ta shape into a white blizzard that blows ever more violentl An AFRICAN ELEPHANT walks with difficulty, staggering and growing faint. As the strengthening storm covers it ina blanket of white, the elephant falters. Its massive body tumbles solemnly to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the sound of a heavy clang, a GIRL's eyes pop open. TITLE: 17 years later, A.D. 2031 In the heavy darkness, her two eyes blink soundlessly. In cramped space, the girl's body undulates to a regular rhy

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: From the day I was born, there has always been this rattling. Because I was born on a moving train. Over the sound of a train's wheels RATTLING:

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm seventeen. The train has been rattling for the past 17 years. Outside the train, I hear the sound of snowflakes falling onto the frozen earth. No one is out there. Everyone is inside, the Train...  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 3.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive, iron Gate fills the screen. A SOLDIER holding rifle, pulls a lever. The Gate slides open to reveal: Endless freight cars, dark and filthy, like alleys in a p village. TAIL SECTION PASSENGERS, shabbily-dressed, looki like vagrants, stand in cramped, packed rows of five acro

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 1
dialogues.text: Head check! Passengers sound off their Numbers - “One” “Two” - and cr into a sitting position, each in turn, row after row, fur and further into the next car, like a cave... Soldier 1 clicks furiously at the counter in his hand: 25 252-253... CURTIS (34) does not count and he does not sit. With a sh glare of concentration, Curtis remains stiffly upright as waves of obedient Passengers count and crouch. Curtis - a lone standing figure.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: Sit down! Curtis shows no concern. He stares past the iron Gate to gate beyond and the one beyond and the next...

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (aiming his gun) I said sit down! Curtis does not budge an inch. Passengers flinch in surpr at the sight of the leveled gun inches from Curtis. His fingers count on his thigh - 2-3-4 - as gates close one b one. EDGAR (20), anxious, sitting, pulls Curtis' pant leg.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Curtis - sit down. Sit down... Curtis sits suddenly - ignoring Soldier 2 and his gun.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the fuck are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Counting.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Can’t you sit and count? You wanna get shot? You’re crazy...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Shut up, Edgar. I’m thinking.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 4. Passengers in the far-off last row finish their count. Hundreds of Passengers crouch in neat, silent rows, their heads bob gently up and down with the movements of the tr SOLDIER 3 steps forward and lifts a megaphone:

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Are there any experienced violinists here? Raise your hands!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Violinist! (mimics playing a violin) Violinist! The Passengers just look around nervously at each other.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Violinists? Fuck that. Bastards in the Front Section listening to string quartets, getting massages, eating fucking steaks...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: We will be different, Edgar. When we get there. When we get there.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: (beat) I want steak. As the soldiers continue to shout, an elderly couple (GER and DORIS) hesitantly raise their hands.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Tell us your background.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: My wife and I played Violin in the Boston Symphony Orchestra. I was first chair... SOLDIER 2 grabs Gerald’s hands - startling him. He examin the hands.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Can you still play?

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Of course. You never forget. The soldiers mutter amongst themselves - “Boston?” - and, after smirking, call out to Gerald.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 5.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Follow me. Leave your belongings, we just need your hands.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Not both?

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: Yes. Both hands.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: (taking DORIS’ hand) My wife, Doris, plays beautifully...

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 3
dialogues.text: They just need one person.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Then I won't go.

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: (approaching) Who the hell do you think you are? Soldier 2 pulls Gerald away from Doris. She shrieks and clutches Soldier 2's arm who whacks her in the face with butt of his rifle. Bleeding, Doris falls and lies, unmovi on the floor. Gerald yells out. Passengers gasp! In the grim, shocked silence, Soldier 2 brutally stomps o Doris’ left hand with his military boot. DORIS screams.

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Dory!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIER 2
dialogues.text: Now she can’t play anyway. Edgar, temper flashing, stands up. Now it is Curtis' turn grab Edgar’s pant leg and pull him back down.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Sit down, Edgar.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: They can’t...we can’t just...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (steely) No. This isn’t the time. Gerald struggles as he is dragged away by Soldiers 1 and

dialogues.speaker: GERALD
dialogues.text: Dory! I'll come back for you... I'll write to you!  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 6. Gerald is dragged through the iron Gate. He calms as soon he is through the gate - a small smile of hope and expectation crosses his face. CLANK - the Gate shuts.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Fucking bastards... Curtis stares at the gates opening as Gerald is dragged through - he counts on his thigh as Edgar prattles - 1-2- 4...

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-always treat us like this and always we just sit here in rows...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Shut up. I’m trying to count.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: We don’t count. SOLDIERS push a cart, with large wheels, filled with pitc black 'protein blocks' that look like chocolate bars. Ina familiar procession, Passengers line up in front of the c and receive their protein blocks. Doris, bleeding, holding her mangled hand, rises and move take a protein block. With bloodied lips she eagerly gulp it down...her flushed, swollen red cheeks twitching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Curtis moves past squatting Passengers chomping protein blocks. One after another, Passengers shake their heads - “No, not me” - as Curtis passes. Edgar hurries to catch u

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Curtis... (stares at his protein block) What does steak look like? I was real young when I got on the train. I don’t remember it at all. Curtis: “...”

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it square like this? I bet it’s damn fucking good, right? LATIN MAN suddenly stands and holds up his hand. Curtis grabs Latin Man’s protein block and finds a hole on the s like on a block of cheese.

dialogues.speaker: LATIN MAN
dialogues.text: The hole!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 7.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (Hands it back) Not it.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Not it. Curtis continues on, Edgar on his heels. TANYA, a large African-American woman, jumps up and down and waves.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Tanya!

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Curtis! Look! Tanya points at TIM, her five year old son who holds up h protein block. Curtis moves to Tim, looking at the block carefully. There is a deep hole at the bottom of the bloc

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Tim-bo - did you find it?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: I did. I got it. (Curtis reaches for it) And I'm keeping it! Tim takes off running. Curtis runs after him. Tanya runs after Tim. Edgar runs after Tim.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Tim! Tim leads us on a merry chase through the Tail Section - slum crowded with multi-ethnic residents - giggling and holding his protein block aloft, through the cubbyholes, blankets, passageways, pipes... Tim barely evades Curtis’ grasp as he darts away. Passeng shout and yell as Tim knocks into them - they jump out of way of the rampaging Curtis, Edgar and Tanya in hot pursu Edgar and Tanya corner Tim only to lose him when he climb the wall and swings from the pipes over their heads. Tim drops and runs - he looks back and laughs and shouts...

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: It’s mine. All mine... .+-and runs smack into Curtis, lying in wait.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Got ya! Curtis snatches up the boy and lifts him in the air, and tickles him. Tim screams in delight and wriggles like a f on a hook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 8.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: No! No, Curtis...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Gimme, gimme - come on, Tim-bo, give it up... Tanya, winded, arrives, huffing and puffing and laughing. Only Edgar does not think this is funny.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Give it up, kid.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: What will it take? What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: In the whole wide train?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: In the whole wide train.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: (face lighting up) The ball!

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: The ball? Oh, no. Not that.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: Yes. Yes. I get the ball for a whole hour.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Done. Tim ceremoniously hands Curtis the protein block. To Edga

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Edgar! Get Tim the ball. Edgar rolls his eyes and walks away muttering.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: What am I - your fucking slave? Tim hurries after Edgar jumping up and down in excitement Curtis shouts after Edgar:

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: You're my trusted number two!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Number two. Great, you know what that is - number two...? Tim holds up two fingers.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 9.

dialogues.speaker: TIM
dialogues.text: It’s two. I’m four hundred and thirty three. You know how long I have to wait to get the ball if I...

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Shut up. Curtis examines the protein block: at the bottom, a thin, deep hole. Curtis nods, satisfied. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Thanks, Tanya.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A sharp knife cuts the protein block, slicing through the hole. WIDER - Curtis cuts carefully and removes a small capsule made of metal and opens it: a rolled up RED PAPER inside. Curtis unrolls the Red Letter and reads the silver letter

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Red letter? * ANGLE - GILLIAM (70's), sits against the back wall of the train, wrapped entirely in rag-like clothes with only his face protruding. *

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Yes. According to our informant, * he’s in the Prison Section now. *

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: So his name is... * (reading) * N, A, M, K, U...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Nam Kung Min Soo.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: Strange name. Nam Koo Soo what?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: We'll just call him Nam. Like Vietnam. The tent flap opens and Edgar appears. Through the open f we get a glimpse of Tim kicking a makeshift ball made of rags tightly wound. *

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: (grabbing the Red Letter) What’s it say?  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 10.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (grabbing it back) Edgar! Curtis takes the Red Letter to a metal wall where dozens others are posted. He puts the new one in the final position.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: (reading over Curtis’ shoulder) The hell... he’s in prison?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: If he’s such a great security expert why can’t he just break himself...?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (sharp) Edgar! Curtis motions with his head for Edgar to leave. EDGAR op his mouth to speak but CURTIS’ look is steely. EDGAR turn pleading face to GILLIAM.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: Out. Edgar, pissed, hurt, reluctantly leaves the tent - he get struck in the head by the ball as he exits. The flap clos

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Tim! Tim speeds off as Edgar gives chase, their clamoring quic subsiding.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (bitterly) I’m sorry. He’s an idiot. But he’s our idiot.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: Young. These train babies. Again, calm silence hangs between them. Curtis takes a de breath then puts protein blocks onto a small table to represent train cars:

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: OK. We’re here, Tail Section, Quarantine section, Prison Section. Gate, gate, gate. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 11.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: According to what I saw today, there were 4 seconds when all three gates were open at the same time. We have four seconds to go through three gates and we'll be in the Prison Section to get Nam out.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: Our fate depends on this Nam guy?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: That’s right. (draws in a deep breath) If we can get him to cooperate, we can seize control right up to the front of the train.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: To the very front section...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Yes. Everything in one stroke. We liberate the whole train. We control the engine, we control the world. If we don’t, we get nothing. Past revolutions all failed because they failed to take the engine.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: So... what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: This time, we take the engine.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: Then what...?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (in a low voice) We waste him. A heavy silence falls between Curtis and Gilliam. They lo at each other calmly.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: «+. Wilford? Curtis nods. train floor:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gilliam's gaze fixes on a metal plate on the Property of Wilford Enterprises. carved in relief on an impressive iron metal plate on the wall: Wilford Enterprises

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: You should govern the train now, not Wilford.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 12.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: I’m a shrunken old man. My day was decades ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE: On Curtis’ face deep in thought, as he lies uncomfortably in a cramped sleeping quarter, constructed of wooden freight boxes. Edgar lies right below him wide awake, looking up at Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Sleeping?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: ...yeah...

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Good night then...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Edgar's eyes stay on the compartment above. All of a sudd they hear the sound of a couple breathing heavily, then t moaning sounds get louder...

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: ...-thinking about Alice, aren’t you?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (sighs) Edgar...

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: I guess it’s possible you don’t remember her so well anymore. It’s been what... 4 years since they dragged her off? She was one fine lady. The ever more agitated movements of the couple cause the boards to creak. Suddenly, scores of strange bugs crawl o from the boards.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: What would it be like?

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Damn fucking good. +e HF

dialogues.text: He HHH OK

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: No. I mean the baby. What if nine months later, the baby is born... and the first thing he sees is this... this place. How would he feel? Curtis squashes a bug. Splat.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: .-.cold. Edgar pulls a dirty rag up to his neck and lets out an ic breath.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: That baby is going to grow up eating tasty soup and potatoes, steak too, in a clean, warm room at the front of the train. And he will go to school.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: School? What was that again? The ear-splitting sound of clanking metal! Curtis, with lightening speed, pokes his head into the hallway. A SHORT SPOTTER runs the hall clanking a metal pan loudly with a stick. Here and there, anxious heads look out from their cubbyholes to check out the commotion.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FLASHING RED LIGHTS signal an inspection. Curtis and Edga run full out toward the Tail Section Entrance, jumping ov people as they go. At the entrance area, where the protein blocks are ration out, Soldiers shove Passengers into line. Curtis pretends join the rows while he keeps his eyes on the Gate. CLOSE-UP of a woman's high heels as she walks through the sliding gate. The camera moves up and we see CLAUDE (earl 30's), pale face and bobbed hair. Behind, following OFFICERS, SOLDIERS and armed POLICE. FUYU, a Japanese Officer, carrying an enormous Atlas and briefcase, stands just behind Claude’s right shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Quiet, everyone!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He HHH OK *

dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 14. Fuyu gives a signal and the Soldiers seize children at random. Parents scream and clutch onto their children, bu they are ripped away. Several dozen children are lined up front of Claude: CHAN, a Chinese boy, a white toddler... SNAP - Claude snaps her fingers and Fuyu unsnaps and open the briefcase. Claude pulls a tape measure from the case without acknowledging Fuyu. Claude steps forward and precisely, wordlessly, quickly measures the children. Each time she finishes measuring a child, the tape retracts with a loud “THWAK!” before she pulls it out again. Parents cry. Curtis is angry - but he puts a restraining hand on Edgar’s arm to keep him in check. Claude measures the arm of ANDY, six years old. His fathe ANDREW, cringes in fear and shouts...

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: No! Claude's piercing, fierce look shuts him up. Claude looks the children - displeased. Then her eye catches something the periphery: in the front row stands Tanya. A round sha bulges from her skirt. CLACK CLACK - Claude walks straight to Tanya, right up to face. They stare at each other, the dark Tanya and the sn white Claude. Curtis stands a few rows behind, observing. Claude pulls out the tape and uses it as a pointer - she gently lifts the skirt with it. Tanya looks down nervousl to reveal: the makeshift ball. Claude glances at Tanya before she lets go of her skirt a turns to walk away. Tanya breathes a quiet sigh of relief Instantly, Claude signals to Fuyu. Two Soldiers run to Ta on Fuyu’s order.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: (tapping her skirt) Run, Timmy! Tim guns out from under Tanya’s skirt and runs to the end the train. Tanya blocks Soldier 1 but misses Soldier 2 rushing after Tim. Tanya and Soldier 1 wrestle as nearby Passengers also get tangled up in the scuffle. AHHHH! A scream breaks out as Soldier 2 drags Tim forward

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Tanya’s eyes go wide in fear but she is paralyzed. Curtis tenses as Tim is dragged to Claude who quickly measures h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HH FH HK

dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 15.

dialogues.speaker: CLAUDE
dialogues.text: (points with her tape) These two. Tim and Andy are dragged off by the departing Soldiers. Claude turns heel to follow. Tanya breaks her paralysis a in a wild frenzy, breaks through the line of shields with Herculean strength. She chases after her son.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Timmy! Mommy’s coming... Combat Police surround her and begin to club her merciles

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: DANCING CLUBS fill the screen - Tanya lies on the floor, down like firewood. While Police focus on Tanya, Andrew breaks through the line like an arrow. Taken by surprise, the Police stare dumbly at him for a second.

dialogues.speaker: ANDREW
dialogues.text: (throwing his shoe) Give me back my son, you fucking bitch!! Claude, at the Gate, turns back to the insulting voice as old shoe sails through the air and the heel smacks her directly in the forehead. Her steely expression does not change. Fuyu cries out in shock. Soldiers grab Andrew and throw him to the ground. Soldier boots kick and kick and kick the bloodied Andrew. Claude touches a pinky to the trickle of blood on her forehead. She looks at it, sucks the blood off and clicks away on her heels. Curtis' mouth hangs open in a shocked stupor. His eyes narrow as he watches the back of the departing Claude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andrew, bruised and bleeding, kneels with his old shoe in mouth. He looks ridiculous. And weak. Soldiers, armed Policemen and high-ranking Officers surro Andrew to watch two gigantic men snip off his shirt with scissors. They are - the FRANCO BROTHERS - that appear to a strange, well-oiled machine. The Franco Brothers work on Andrew like a couple of butch dressing a dead cow, greasing his arm with a blue liquid Fuyu consults his thick “Atlas:” maps show the intertwini rail lines. He speaks to himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 16.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: .--Longitude 10 degrees 45... Fuyu closes his Atlas with a smack and writes calculation the Franco Brothers place a METAL RING around Andrew’s ar just below his armpit. On the wall, above Andrew’s kneeli form, is an identical metal ring.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At this high elevation, we need only 7 minutes. Tail Section passengers grimace in anger, pain and sympat A few turn around to regard Curtis whose face also regist pain and rage. Gilliam is glimpsed behind him. Fuyu suffers a pang of remorse looking at Andrew, before putting a hefty clock on Andrew’s neck. It’s a timer cloc being used for measuring cooking time. He pushes the butt to activate the clock. Fuyu turns around and bows politely to a well-dressed, we groomed middle-aged man who comes forward. He is MINISTER MASON who appears rather mild and cultured.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Seven minutes allotted for your speech, sir. Mason nods and picks up a wireless microphone, standing i front of Andrew, whose face is distorted in great pain.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: This is so disappointing. Behind Mason, Fuyu and a FEMALE OFFICER repeat his statem

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: (in Japanese) This is so disappointing.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) This is so disappointing.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: (in French) This is so disappointing.

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE OFFICER
dialogues.text: (in Chinese) This is so disappoint...

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Cut that out - I only have seven minutes. (he lifts the shoe) Passengers, this is not a shoe.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 17.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: (sullenly silent)

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: This is disorder. This is size ten chaos. This - see this - this is death. No one pays attention to Mason, all are focused on Andrew agony. MASON (CONT’D) In this locomotive we call home, we have but one barrier between our warm hearts and the bitter cold. (waves the shoe) Clothing? Shields? No! Order! INSERT - the train races down the dark mountain side. Andrew's arm exposed outside the train freezes in a ragin snowstorm. MASON (0.S.) (CONT’D) Order is the barrier that holds back the frozen death. Order. We - all of us Passengers on the Train of Life - must remain in our allotted stations.

dialogues.text: For every gate you open, one lump of Chronole.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: It’s the best shit. Uncut. Straight from the barrel. Curtis flips the lump to Namgoong. Namgoong lets it drop the floor and stares at Curtis. Beat. He bends down, seemingly to pick it up but instead removes a piece of cigarette and a MATCHBOOK from his shoe. “Wow!” - everyone looks with eyes rounded like saucers.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Marlboro Lights?!

dialogues.speaker: PAINTER
dialogues.text: Holy shit - cigarettes have been extinct for a decade now... ON MATCHBOOK: a bright sun blazes over a beautiful sandy beach, advertising “FIJI” Everyone pushes forward to watch Namgoong open the matchb FOUR MATCHES. He plucks one, strikes it, lights the cigarette and sucks on it for a long stretch. Everyone is dizzy in shock. Even Curtis’ eyes flutter as the smell hi him.

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: (to Curtis) You want some, asshole? Namgoong blows smoke in the air. Several people breathe i the scattered wisps of smoke, their eyelids fluttering.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 35. NAMGOONG (CONT’D) I bet you fuckheads never smoked one before, huh?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: You're a fucking Chronohead so let me make this real simple for you. Help us, you get your drug. Don’t, we put you back where we found you. What’1ll it be, asshole?

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: The People tense up. A Chinese boy suddenly runs to Nam a snatches the matchbook from his hand. People shocked, sta at Chan running off. Namgoong stares at him and then throws the cigarette butt aside. “Yikes!” - all at once, the crowd dives toward the butt. space between Namgoong and Curtis fills with milling bodi POW - Namgoong’s fist lands squarely in the center of Edg face - blood erupts. He kneels on Edgar’s abdomen and snatches the keys from Edgar’s hands. He rises... KAPOW! Namgoong knocks out each man who tries to stop him from “escaping.” Curtis grabs Namgoong’s shirt. But Namgoong stops before another drawer and locates a key. Namgoong opens the lock and pulls the drawer out to revea YONA (17), an Asian girl, dead asleep despite all the commotion in the section. He pokes at the girl’s head. NAMGOONG (CONT’D) Get up.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Shit... Yona reluctantly sits up - dirty and clad in short pants a T-shirt. She drapes herself in rags she used as a blank

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: My daughter, Yona. If I go, she goes too.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: So you're coming with us?

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: One gate, two lumps of Chronole. Two people - two lumps.  18 SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 36. Yona completely ignores the curious stares from the crowd concentrates on dressing. She seems totally out of it; carelessly yawns, then burps. Curtis considers her.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: She’s an addict, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE UP of Yona’s strange, dreamy eyes. YONA’'S POV: Namgoong manipulates complicated machinery i a wall panel with spider-dancing fingers. The Steel Gate flanked by the Rebel Army, ready to jump as soon as it op Yona suddenly grins a little and mumbles:

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Nobody there.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Nobody...? Yona puts her hand out and shouts clearly in English:

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: No Chronole, no opening! Curtis hands Yona two lumps of Chronole, while keeping hi eyes on Namgoong. SWOOSH - the hydraulic gate opens. Edgar and the Army, weapons out, flood into the next Section to find it total empty. Deflated, they move gingerly into the forward section. Curtis regards Yona suspiciously...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: How did you know...? Yona rushes to Namgoong with her prizes - Chronole. Namgoong, holding a lump in each hand, claps and rubs the together with furious speed. The Chronole crumbles to dus which Namgoong continuously and eagerly sniffs. Yona, next to him, stamps her feet repeatedly waiting for turn until Nam passes the chronole to her. Sniffing, sniffing... Druggies. Curtis shakes his head and turns back to his Ar

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Forward! Move!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Forward! Move!  19 SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 37.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Edgar and the Army advance, repeating after Curtis. Gilli and Grey bring up the rear. Namgoong and Yona, playfully kicking each other, move into a corner to sniff Chronole. Edgar breaks the silence:

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Where the fuck is everybody? EDGAR’s POV: the Prison Guards have left in a rush. The floor is strewn with shields and clubs.

dialogues.speaker: PAINTER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This can't be a window, can it? At that moment, the train moves out of a tunnel, and the walls on the sides are revealed to be windows. Dazzling sunlight pours into the section through the wide windows. The Rebel Army is regaled with a sight that none of them witnessed for seventeen years: a mind-blowing vista of fr snowscape, that seems to stretch to eternity. Everyone is frozen in place, mouths open, eyes wide open amazement.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Fuck me.

dialogues.speaker: PAINTER
dialogues.text: Oh my God, it’s so... so... beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: So huge... Gilliam is the only one who does not look like a deer cau in the headlights.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: -+-and still cold. The train races through the frozen snow plain. Then, a lo abandoned train station in a small town can be seen - on platform are piles of corpses, frozen to death in the mid of a fierce struggle to get on the train to survive. GILLIAM (CONT’D) Dead. All dead. The long-frozen landscape of the small town rushes past - overturned cars frozen in place, helicopters suspended wh they crashed. A doomsday landscape preserved in the exact state of their final moments, flickers past without end..  20 SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 38. Curtis is mesmerized but he pulls himself back from his trance - he shakes his head violently to re-focus. He loo away. He pokes, prods and pulls at his Army.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Enough! We didn’t come for this. Everyone focus! Keep moving!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Keep moving! Everyone tears themselves away from the endlessly unfoldi snowscape to look forward once again. Painter pulls out h sketchbook and furiously captures what he has seen. Namgoong opens a small panel on the floor by the next Gat Yona once again opens her palm to Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: No Chronole, no opening!

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (handing out the lumps) How did you know there wasn’t anybody in here? Yona does not acknowledge Curtis. Like a zoo monkey with banana, she snatches away the lumps of Chronole and hasti retreats. Namgoong’s efforts produce a bright spark. Yona suddenly straightens up - her head cocked to one sid she looks at the Gate.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Coming this way... He’s running...??

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (not understanding)
SWOOOOSH - a heavier sound this time as the steel Gate op Everyone waits anxiously as Curtis steps into:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH-SPEED CAM: a slow motion image of PAUL, a man in a w chef's uniform, running toward the bewildered Army.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Paul? Paul jumps up and grabs a ceiling pipe. Hanging down, he grunts and swings, turning one of the valves in a weird w

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Paul!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 39. Paul, barely acknowledging and bowing his head carelessly jumps down with a boom and breathlessly runs off to tend big machine resembling a fertilizer manufacturing device.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Paul, man! I don’t believe it! How many years has it been since they dragged you...?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Give me a second. It used to work automatically... Paul runs and jumps up onto another pipe. Grunting, he tu a valve, twitching like a pig in a butcher shop. Curtis a Edgar move to him as he drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: (embarrassed) The parts went extinct so I have to do this manually...

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Do what? Paul hurries away to another valve which he turns once an WHOOSH - the machine kicks in and begins spitting out pro blocks from its mouth. The Army gathers around the machin watching with curiosity and affection.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Ah ha - so that’s how it’s made... Painter flips the sketchbook page from Frozen Landscape t blank page to draw the machine as he circles it. Behind, discovers a black powdery substance - the raw material fo the protein blocks - passing through a thick glass tube. Curtis pulls Paul aside from the machine and the others.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: So you're the informant?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What? Hey!! Paul sees Painter climbing to a platform to look inside t tank feeding the glass tube. He runs after him.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! No - get away from there. Painter pulls back a hatch on top of the tank and looks inside just as Paul arrives to shove him aside!  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 40.

dialogues.speaker: PAINTER
dialogues.text: Yecch! Painter bends over, ready to throw up. Curtis looks insid the tank.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: CURTIS’ POV: the tank is full of millions of cockroaches, interlocked in a hellish vision of crawling, squirming movement. They seem to be cannibalizing one another. Crushed body parts are visible. The cockroaches are fed i a grinder that turns them to black powder.

dialogues.speaker: PAINTER
dialogues.text: All this time, we’ve been eating...?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: I eat them, too, you know...every single day...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (to painter) You can’t draw this. Painter nods, still gagging, as he rips the page from his sketchbook and tears it up. ANGLE - the Army eats fresh protein blocks spewing from t machine’s output belt. Tanya, her mouth full, shoves bloc into her pockets.

dialogues.speaker: TANYA
dialogues.text: Oh my God, oh my God, they’re still hot. Mmmm - fresh, yummy... Painter, watching this, now vomits.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (looking at Tanya) This is the last time. We’ll never have to eat that shit again.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: What else would they...?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: We're going to the front - come with us Paul. Join us.

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: The front? No - my place is here.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1,

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Here - making that? Fuck that. Come with us - we’ll change everything. (Paul shakes his head) Isn't that why you’ve been sending us the Red Letters?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: Oh - these? (he takes a metal capsule from his pocket) I don’t write them. I just send them on.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: You don’t...? Curtis snatches the capsule and opens it as he comes back down the ladder. Gilliam moves to join Curtis.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: Red letter, lad? ON RED LETTER: “W A T E R”

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: .--Water?

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: The Water Supply Section?

dialogues.speaker: PAUL
dialogues.text: It’s only a few cars away. That’s where the water is cleansed and recycled.

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: It’s one of the most crucial sections in the train...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: If we seize it - we'll have the upper hand, yes?

dialogues.speaker: GILLIAM
dialogues.text: We won’t even have to get all the way to the front. We control the water, we control the negotiation. Gilliam shrugs. Curtis’ eyes are ablaze as he looks ahead the next Gate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 21 SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 42.

dialogues.speaker: SECTION
dialogues.text: Namgoong works on a complicated panel, his eyes vaguely unfocused. He frowns - things are not going his way. He switches wires around but nothing happens.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: (frustrated) Come on already! You're keeping us waiting? Namgoong looks around, not a bit flustered, pushing the sensor portion of the translator against his lower neck.

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: Am I?

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: That's right. You've been sucking on Chronole so much, your brain is probably protein gruel by now!

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: Hey, Chronole is the only reason I‘m doing this shit.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: That stuff’s the reason you’re such a head case, man!

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: You're the one who gives me the stuff every time I open the gate.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: That’s the condition for opening the gate!

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: So that’s what I’m doing, trying to open the gate. While this surreal verbal sparring through the electronic sound of the translator machine is going on, everyone wit weapons in their hands is getting tired, waiting in front the door.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Yona? Yona: “what do you want?”

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How old are you?

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Seventeen.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 43.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: You're a train baby, then?

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Hee hee. It’s been rattling like this all my life. ‘Bout you?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: I lived in New York for seventeen years. Then the Tail Section seventeen years.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: 34. You're old. What was New York like?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Not that different from the tail section. Crowded and dirty.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: So your whole life has been crowded and dirty.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, pretty much. In New York, I was drifting around like a lost turd.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: And now?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: I'm different now.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Now I know where I’m going.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: To the front.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Mmm. .

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Hey, Yona. Were you born clairvoyant?

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Clair... What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 44. Curtis and Yona standing in front of the gate.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Can you see what’s beyond this gate? Do you see anything?

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: I see sounds. (he doesn’t understand) I can even see the sound of snow falling outside... Yona lapses into silence - listening. She suddenly contor her face in fear.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: (quietly) Don’t open it... Yona, deathly pale, jumps up and screams shrilly at Namgo

dialogues.speaker: LOCK THE GATE
dialogues.text: Everyone is stunned by her unexpected scream which comes late: WHOOSH - the Steel Gate opens and heavily armored Soldier carrying hand-axes flow in.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (rising and shouting) Teams 1 and 2 Forward!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Teams 1...! Edgar's command is drowned out as the Army rises up with roar and steel rods. CLASH - axe blades clash against steel rods - sparks fly! Bodies and blades clash and slice. The axe blades cut swa of silver in the air and push back the Army. Grey stands protectively in front of Gilliam. Curtis move Yona back, handing her to the retreating Namgoong. He joi the battle swinging a big metal bat down on a Soldier. He snatches the Soldier's falling hand-axe and kills him. SPLASH - blood is showered on Curtis' face. He does not hesitate: eyes burning with savage bloodlust, he swings a swings his newfound weapon. Sunlight pours through the windows. The sweat and blood o the galvanized bodies shine like jewels.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 45. The screams, shouts and grunts gradually dwindle replaced the cold metallic clanging of axe-blades striking steel a the rattling of the train. Arabic Man fights a Soldier with one hand while stuffing face with a hoarded protein block with the other. Fuyu enters with his Atlas and a Bullhorn. He consults hi Atlas, then his wristwatch and nods to an ATTENDANT who sounds an enormous HORN - WAAAAA. Fuyu lifts the bullhorn

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: (beep from the bullhorn) Passing Yekaterina Bridge! Curtis and the Soldier he is fighting stop and peek outsi the window. It dawns on everybody what is happening. Soldiers and Army alike, breathing hard, stop fighting an drop their weapons to look out the window.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Yekaterina Bridge? It’s been a year, already?

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Ten seconds to Yekaterina Bridge! Ten, nine... Everyone joins in the countdown in a babel of languages:

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Eight, seven, six, five, four, three, two, one!

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: (loudly, through bullhorn) Happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: SOLDIERS
dialogues.text: Happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: (abruptly shouting) Fuck it, I hate getting old... Fuyu leads the Officers chanting Buddhist-like prayers.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Youkiguni dai zohachinen, engine yo aei en ni. (The 18th year of the snow piercer, Engine be forever!)

dialogues.speaker: OFFICERS
dialogues.text: (like chorus) Engine yo aei en ni! Wilford Ban zai!  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 46. Curtis and Army stare at this ceremony, uncomprehending.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Everybody down! Edgar drops face down on the floor. Everybody follows sui A Soldier with a peculiar helmet prays.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (in French) Everybody down! (in Japanese) Everybody down!

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Get down! Watch your tongues! Clamp your teeth! Everyone gets down except Fuyu who walks to the window an Curtis who, kneeling, glues his face to the window-pane. CURTIS’ POV: as the train makes a stiff turn, the ENGINE can be seen - ridiculously far away. It’s silver, sleek rounded, bullet-shape nose races along the frozen landsca

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wilford... The nose transforms into a sharp arrow-headed lance to pi the unseen snow and ice ahead. The front section races onto a precarious-looking bridge a vast valley of frozen ice fields. It is God-knows-how m hundreds of feet down to the valley floor in a descent al totally vertical. FUYU’S POV: massive white boulders of snow and ice block path of the rapidly approaching engine - closer and close

dialogues.speaker: IMPACT
dialogues.text: Curtis flattens beside Edgar. The train shakes like a submarine hit directly by a torpedo. Everybody screams an tries to grab something to keep them from flying away. The wheels jump into thin air for a half-second then smas down on the rails amidst a rain of sparks. The train slow regains its stable rhythm. People sigh in relief.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Not yet! A second one!

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Hold on! Once again, the train crashes into a large block of snow, shaking violently from the impact.  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 47. ANGLE - Soldiers and Rebel Army crouch low on the floor. Beyond them - Yona and Namgoong stand straight up with Chronole held to their noses. Edgar sees them and shouts:

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Hey! Get down on the floor! Namgoong crouches down as if to follow Edgar's advice but instead, hoists Yona up on his shoulders. High on Chronol he walks unsteadily towards the window as Yona laughs.

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That guy doesn’t follow the rules...

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: He’s crazy - we have to watch out for him. Namgoong and Yona press their noses to the glass, they lo down at the dizzying depths below.

dialogues.speaker: YONA
dialogues.text: Wow!

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: Sure enough, a thrill that comes once a year... NAMGOONG’S POV: a dizzying glimpse of a gorge down below. Yona, either from the drugs or the view, squeals in delig

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Yukino katamarida~! The train smashes through snow boulders - white, crystall fragments slide off into the valley, so far down they get lost in the white. Lurching wildly, the train shakes left and right, up and down... Tumbling, the people roll and crash into each other. With Yona on Namgoong's shoulders, the two become even more excited and shout loudly.

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG/YONA
dialogues.text: Aaaaaaaaahhhhhh! The wheels of the train shake so wildly that it seems it about to derail, but finally they take a precarious hold the tracks and become stable. Fuyu pulls himself upright and, carefully looking out tow the front of the train, pronounces:

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Safe passage!  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 48. The train moves off the perilous bridge onto solid ground Everyone - Soldiers and Army alike - rise and cheer; peop cross themselves, others embrace, some resume chanting:

dialogues.speaker: OFFICERS
dialogues.text: Engine yo aei en ni! Wilford Ban zai!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: We made it! Curtis brandishes his axe in a fearsome gesture. Edgar an Arabic Man, flanking Curtis, raise their weapons. CLASH - the two sides form up and the battle resumes! Suddenly, a spear flies in from out of nowhere and pierce Arabic Man’s chest. As he falls, another heavy spear flie through the air towards Curtis. At the last moment, Curti deflects the spear with his axe blade. Everyone turns and looks in the direction from which the spears came: the Franco Brothers. With expressionless faces, the brothers advance. Directly behind, Mason appears. In this strange lull in the fighti Mason walks forward with a hard expression and a micropho His cold voice issues from the speakers:

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: Happy Yekaterina Bridge, you filthy ingrates! The blood-spattered faces of Curtis and Edgar, and behind them Gilliam, turn towards Mason. MASON (CONT’D) You people, who if not for the benevolent Wilford, would have frozen solid 18 years ago today! You people, who have sucked on the generous tit of Wilford for food and shelter! And now... You pathetic stowaways, you repay his kindness with violent hooliganism?

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: You people... (checks memo) .+-precisely 74% of you shall die!

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Fuck you! It is you who is going to die!  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 49. Curtis' hand-axe, whistling through the air, somersaults toward Mason’s head but is intercepted by Franco the Elde iron club with a loud clang. Mason regards Curtis, half- insane with rage, with a preternatural calm.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: My friend - you suffer the misplaced optimism of the doomed. Mason nods to Fuyu who comes forward opening a large canv bag: inside are weird-looking glasses. CLOSE-UP reveals them to be infrared goggles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Franco Brothers and the Soldiers fit themselves with goggles. Mason follows suit.

dialogues.speaker: MASON
dialogues.text: I'll watch from here. Edgar and the Army stare uncomprehendingly.

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: (in Korean) You guys are fucked.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: (putting the interpreter earphone in) What did you say? Curtis turns to see: Namgoong, holding a pulled off panel squeezing Yona into the gap in the wall. *

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: You Tail Section hicks. There’s no way you could know there’s a tunnel right after Yekaterina Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: A tunnel?

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: That’s right. A fucking long one. Namgoong swiftly puts the panel back on the wall over Yon confused face. * NAMGOONG (CONT’D) (after taking a deep * breath) * Run, idiots!  SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 50. The lights go off one by one until the Train enters the tunnel. We are plunged into darkness. Soldiers, in frog- like goggles, flash as green after-images, then are gone. HMMMMM - a low hum is heard. * A SOLDIER'S POV: everything is awash in sickly green: the Rebels move frantically about, running into walls and eac other. The Franco Brothers and Soldiers charge at them. * Screams and shouts emanate from every corner. A Soldier creeps up next to an Army fighter entangled with another Soldier and lifts his hand-axe slowly above the fighter’s head, grinning. Franco the Younger aims his spear at another warrior who swings his steel pipe blindly and desperately, without ai Franco the Younger pushes and pulls the tip of his spear close to the latter’s face, having sadistic fun with it.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Light! We need light!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: (feeling his way along the wall) Light!

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Nam! Can you turn the lights back on!?

dialogues.speaker: NAMGOONG
dialogues.text: No... * Namgoong is already running as fast as he can to the back pushing and stepping over people. Horrible sounds of bone breaking, veins bursting, flesh tearing and the skin-craw sound of metal on metal fill the place. * Fuyu follows close on the heels of the Franco brothers, clicking a counter as each man falls down dead. He seems be smiling but, incongruously, his eyes behind the goggle are full of tears.

dialogues.speaker: FUYU
dialogues.text: Nana, Hachi... Mason, like a school principal inspecting a children’s exercise, watches calmly. Curtis' face shows despair for the first time, as the bod of his Army pile up. Then, suddenly remembering: INSERT - (from Scene # 17) image of Namgoong dropping the matchbook on the floor and Chan snatching it up.  22 23 SNOWPIERCER (Nov 1, 2011) 51.

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: Chan! CHAN! We need fire!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
dialogues.text: Chan?

dialogues.speaker: CURTIS
dialogues.text: To the rear! Chan! We need fire!

dialogues.speaker: EDGAR
